opinions.snippet:
OPINION OF THE COURT
Gloria Goldstein, J.
This is an automobile personal injury action in which the issue was whether there had been a "serious injury” as defined in subdivision 4 of section 671 of the Insurance Law so as to permit a recovery for noneconomic loss under section 673 of the Insurance Law. This court ruled that this issue raised a question of fact for the jury. The jury answered in the affirmati

caseNameFull: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF COLORED PEOPLE, a/k/a NAACP and Hall, Leroy, Jr. v. The CITY OF EVERGREEN, ALABAMA, a municipal corporation Tuggle, O.B., individually and as mayor of the City of Evergreen, Alabama and the Evergreen Housing Board and Authority
court: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit

opinions.snippet: PER CURIAM: Appellant, National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (“NAACP”), appeals from an award of attorney’s fees in its favor against Appellees, City of Evergreen and its Mayor (“City”)1, alleging that the district court abused its discretion in reducing the amount of the award requested. We vacate the award and remand for reconsideration in light of this opinion.

caseNameFull: State of Connecticut v. Earl Reddick

opinions.snippet:
Stoughton, J.
The defendant was convicted, after trial to a jury, of burglary in the first degree, in violation of General Statutes § 53a-101 (a) (1), and criminal possession of a firearm, in violation of General Statutes § 53a-217. From that judgment, the defendant appeals.
Three of the claims the defendant presses on appeal will not be reviewed owing to the defendant’s failure to comply with Practice Book § 4
